text: what do you think the most effective
negotiation tactic is three researchers
used AI to find out they developed an
algorithm that helped them analyze
hundreds of hours of negotiation
recordings down to the millisecond they
analyze factors like who made the first
offer how much a negotiator smiled their
speaking speed interruptions pronoun
usage and whether they acted tough
polite or warm the biggest predictor of
personal success was the number of
open-ended questions The Negotiator
asked open-ended questions prompt
responses that are nearly twice as long
and twice as informative as responses to
close-ended questions the depth of
information in those responses gives The
Negotiator a better understanding of the
other person's position interests and
constraints the researchers also found a
difference in responses to questions
that started with why how and what why
questions elicited longer and more
detailed responses revealing useful
information but also leading to a more
negative sentiment how questions tended
to generate a positive sentiment but
less detailed responses what questions
fell right in between providing a
balance between gathering information
and maintaining a neutral or positive
tone before your next negotiation
prepare around 3 to five open-ended
questions with a balance between why how
and what
